file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-41-02-04 - BRAKE CONTROL UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BRAKE CONTROL UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Brake Control Unit. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 32-41-02-000-801-A BRAKE CONTROL UNIT - REMOVAL ALL 32-41-02-400-801-A BRAKE CONTROL UNIT - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-41-02 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-41-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BRAKE CONTROL UNIT - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the brake control unit. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 124 221GF Floor in the cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the BRAKES OUTBD and BRAKES INBD circuit breakers, and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them. (2) Open the floor access panel 221GF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the electrical connectors (1). (2) Remove the bolts (3) and washers (4). (3) Remove the brake control unit (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-41-02 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Brake Control Unit - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 124 B DET. A 3. BOLT (4) 2. BRAKE CONTROL UNIT 4. WASHER (4) 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR DET. B 145AMM320120.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-41-02 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-41-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. BRAKE CONTROL UNIT - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the brake control unit. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 32-41-00-700-801-A/500 MAIN BRAKE SYSTEM - FUNCTIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 124 221GF Floor in the cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the cockpit I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the brake control unit (2) in position. (2) Install the washers (4) and bolts (3). (3) Connect the electrical connectors (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the BRAKES OUTBD and BRAKES INBD circuit breakers, and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-41-02 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Do the functional check of the Main Brake System ( AMM TASK 32-41-00-700-801-A/ 500). (3) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Aircraft Maintenance Program. (4) Close the floor access panel 221GF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-41-02 Page 5 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
